Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there's any I/O error in process

listFiles

public static java.io.File[] listFiles(java.io.File fFolder)
Safely lists files in a given folder, without crashing your program with NullPointerExceptions.

Parameters:
fFolder - Folder in which to look
Returns:
Array of files (zero-length if there aren't any, and never null)

loadResource

public static byte[] loadResource(java.lang.Class<?> c,
                                  java.lang.String sName)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Loads a resource relative to a specific class into a byte array.

Parameters:
c - Class (resource must come from same classloader)
sName - Name of resource (relative path to class)
Returns:
Byte array containing file in memory
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If it doesn't exist or there is any other error loading

loadResource

public static byte[] loadResource(java.lang.ClassLoader cl,
                                  java.lang.String sPath)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Loads a resource from the classloader (e.g. the .jar file) into a byte array.

Parameters:
cl - Classloader resource comes from
sPath - Path of resource (must begin with /)
Returns:
Byte array containing file in memory
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If it doesn't exist or there is any other error loading
